subject: Business
title: Positioning: Owning a Word in the Mind
description: One-minute skill: Positioning: Owning a Word in the Mind.

hook.text: Say 'search.' You think Google. Say 'electric car.' You think Tesla. That's positioning.

buildup.text: Al Ries and Jack Trout argued: the real battle isn't in the market. It's in the customer's mind.

discovery.text: Positioning means occupying a distinct, memorable concept in the mind of your target audience.

twist.text: You can't be everything to everyone. Trying to own too many words means you own none.

climax.text: Volvo owns 'safety.' BMW owns 'driving.' Each abandoned other positions to dominate one.

punchline.text: Own one word in your customer's brain. That's your position.

quiz.question: What does 'positioning' mean in marketing strategy?
options: Occupying a distinct concept in the customer's mind
Placing products on specific store shelves
Setting the lowest price in the market
